goal.ch:
“說故事“向來被認為是人文學科的特長，然而在現實世界，真正能夠獲得大眾注目總是那些非人文學科畢業的網紅。這門課就是要提供“說故事“的技巧、提供帶領大眾航向(navigate)歷史的能力；我們將強調，真正好的“說故事“方式在於運用具有當代關懷與宏觀歷史脈絡，讓去呈現紛繁複雜的歷史。
這門課的重點在實作，授課老師會帶領學生從撰寫文案出發，實際進行一場帶有展演性質的“說故事“經驗。
本次課程的最終展演將在大稻埕進行，並以黃玉偕文史館為展演基地。
goal.en:
“Telling a story“ has always been considered a talent in the humanities. Nowadays, YouTubers are often seen as the most popular storytellers. This course will teach the know-how of “telling a story“ and help you reach a wide audience. The instructor will demonstrate how to effectively tell a story by presenting the complex past through a comprehensive historical perspective and contemporary awareness.

The main focus of the course is to practice storytelling techniques through writing in each student‘s native language. This approach will guide students to deliver compelling stories and achieve excellent performances in storytelling.
The final performance of this course will take place in Dadaocheng, using the Huang Yukai Museum of Literature and History as the base for outdoor lectures. This setting will allow students to immerse themselves in the historical and cultural context of the area, enhancing their ability to convey Dadaocheng‘s history to the audience through live guided tours and presentations.

gradMethod.ch:
出席：20％
出席成績以出缺席為主要計算標準，無故缺席將扣4％，並視課堂參與程度酌予加分。
期末導覽文本（母語與外文）：40％
期末外文導覽文本將以導覽文稿為主體，搭配導覽手冊、導覽手板等輔助說明工具，導覽手冊與導覽手板可以線上或雲端方式呈現（必須提供QR Code)

期末外文分組導覽展演：40％
期末外文分組報告將依據事前採排與大稻埕現地展演等兩個部份加總評分。
事前彩排在教室進行，必須搭配預計導覽地點的相關場景、老照片以及歷史文物所製作的簡報，簡報形式不拘。
現地展演方式為授課教師陪同之下，經一人或者一組以上外國遊客同意，向其進行約10-15分鐘的導覽，導覽過程以全程錄影為宜。（若是願意進行第二人次／二組的導覽會酌予加分。）

備註：每組人數以４人為上限，組內需設組長為聯絡窗口，組內分工由組長協調分配，授課教師在適當時候得介入。期末展演，每組需專人協助錄影錄音，並同意由授課教師再製剪輯為專題影像。
gradMethod.en:
評量配分比重(英文)
Attendance: 20％
The attendance score is mainly calculated based on absence. Unexcused absences will be deducted by 4％, and additional points will be awarded depending on the degree of class participation.

End-of-term History Guides ‘text: 40％
The text at the end of the term will be based on the guide manuscript, with guide manuals, guide tablets and other auxiliary explanation tools. The guide manuals and guide tablets can be presented online or in the cloud (QR Code must be provided).

End-of-term group Historical tour performance: 40％
The performance will be based on the total score of the two parts: rehearsal and performance in Dadaocheng.
The rehearsal is held in the classroom beforehand and must be accompanied by a briefing prepared by relevant photos and historical relics of the expected tour location. The format of the briefing can be arbitrary.
The on-site performance method is to conduct a 10-15 minute guided tour accompanied by the teaching teacher and with the consent of one or more foreign tourists. The entire tour process is preferably videotaped. (Extra points will be given if you are willing to conduct a second person/group tour.)

Note: The number of people in each group is limited to 4 people. The group leader must be the contact window. The division of labor within the group shall be coordinated and assigned by the group leader. The teaching teacher shall intervene at the appropriate time. For the final performance, each group needs a dedicated person to help record the video, and agrees to have the instructor re-produce and edit it into a special video.
